meanings.definition: A person appointed to a position of authority or command.
meanings.sent1: The school praefect ensured that students followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The company praefect led the team to success.
meanings.sent3: The praefect of the playground made sure everyone played fair.
meanings.sent4: She was the praefect of the book club, guiding members through literary adventures.
meanings.sent5: The wise praefect was respected by all for his leadership skills.

meanings.definition: A military officer in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The Roman praefect commanded the soldiers with authority.
meanings.sent2: The praefect oversaw the training of new recruits.
meanings.sent3: The praefect joked that even the ancient Romans had to deal with paperwork.
meanings.sent4: In battle, the praefect stood tall like a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The praefect's armor gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of strength and honor.

meanings.definition: An official in charge of a particular department or institution.
meanings.sent1: The hospital praefect managed the nursing staff efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The museum praefect curated the new exhibit with care.
meanings.sent3: The praefect of snacks in the office always kept the pantry stocked.
meanings.sent4: She was the praefect of customer service, ensuring every issue was resolved.
meanings.sent5: The diligent praefect organized the files meticulously for easy access.
